basics.name: Maansi Desai
basics.label: Computational Neuroscienst | Postdoctoral Fellow | Independent Consultant. Interested in using machine learning to solve the brain
basics.summary: I am computational neuroscienst with a background in speech, audio, electrophysiology, and machine learning

work.name: Paradromics Inc., Austin TX, USA
work.summary: Developing and refining experiment designs for speech and language neural prosthesis and developing material to describe neural prosthesis to technical and non-technical audiences.

work.name: The University of Texas at Austin, Austin TX, USA
work.summary: Using feature extraction and sustem identification techniques (linear encoding and decoding models) to investigate acoustic, phonetic, and visual processing of speech, audiovisual information, and other natural sounds in the brains of children and adults with drug resistant epilepsy using intracranial recordings.
highlights: Speech, audiovisual processing, computational neuroscience, machine learning

work.name: The University of Texas at Austin, Austin TX, USA
work.summary: Executed experimental design, data collection, and analyzed brain responses of scalp EEG and intracranial electrophysiology data using statistical analysis and machine learning.
highlights: Published 4 journal papers, 10 conference presentations, 3 research talks, and managed 6 undergraduates

work.name: Meta Inc., Redmond WA, USA
work.position: Research Intern, Hearing Science and Auditory Perception
work.summary: Led the first human neuroscience electrophysiology task and system development and implemented linear classification methods and other machine learning techniques for auditory attention decoding.

work.name: University of California, San Francisco, San Francisco CA, USA
work.summary: Collaborated in multiple projects concerning EEG, ECoG, and deep-brain stimulation data (in hospital settings and at patient homes), preprocessed neural data, organized large datasets, and conducted preliminary analysis on multiple projects concerning the physiology and neural networks of mesolimbic brain stucture of learning-related mechaniams in anxiety, depression, and chronic neuropathic pain.

education.institution: The University of Texas at Austin, Austin TX, USA
education.area: Auditory and Computational Neuroscience - Dept. of Speech, Language and Hearing Sciences

education.institution: The University of Texas at Austin, Austin TX, USA
education.area: Auditory and Computational Neuroscience - Dept. of Communication Sciences and Disorders

education.institution: University of California, Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara CA, USA

publications.name: Decoding Natural Positive Emotional Behaviors from Human Fronto-Temporal Mesolimbic Structures
publications.summary: Investigated the correlation between annotated affective behavior from patients in the EMU linked with the corresponding neural data to decode mood and provide objective measurements for future diagnosis and clinical treatments.

publications.name: Direct cortical stimulation of inferior frontal cortex disrupts both speech and music production in highly trained musicians
publications.summary: This paper examined the neural correlates of speech and music production in two epilepsy patients who underwent cortical stimulation mapping.

publications.name: Brain Stimulation Can Help Us Understand Music and Language
publications.summary: Paper geared towards children to explain cortical stimulation, speech, language and music. This paper is based off of Cognitive Neuropsychology paper published in 2019.

publications.name: Musical hallucinations in chronic pain: the anterior cingulate cortex regulates internally generated percepts
publications.summary: Case study examining musical hallucinations in the anterior cingulate cortex in two patients undergoing a clinical trial on deep-brain stimulation for chronic neuropathic pain.

publications.name: Keyword-spotting and speech onset detection in EEG-based Brain Computer Interfaces
publications.summary: Utilized deep learning models to design and examine the onset of phoneme and silence information in naturalistic speech sentence listening from scalp EEG data.

publications.name: Generalizable EEG encoding models with naturalistic audiovisual stimuli
publications.summary: Investigated speech encoding of acoustic and phonetic information using naturalistically audiovisual movie trailer stimuli in scalp EEG participants. The motivation of this study was to assess if it was possible to replace more controlled experimental paradigms such as sentence listening with more engaging and naturalistic stimuli.

publications.name: Decoding naturalistic affective behaviour from spectro-spatial features in multiday human iEEG
publications.summary: Decoded positive and negative mood states from neural data linked with behavioral annotated information from patients in the EMU.

publications.name: A comparison of EEG encoding models using audiovisual stimuli and their unimodal counterparts
publications.summary: Investigated encoding of auditory, visual, and audiovisual information using naturalistic movie trailers in scalp EEG

publications.name: Dataset size considerations for robust acoustic and phonetic speech encoding models in EEG
publications.summary: Assessed the amount of data needed for building encoding models using a variety of natural speech stimuli. Identifying the amount of data required for robust and generalizable results may be fruitful when time is limited for data collection, particularly when working children or clinical populations.

publications.name: First-in-human prediction of chronic pain state using intracranial neural biomarkers
publications.summary: Used deep-brain stimulation from chronic pain patients to decode elevated pain states from the anterior cingulate cortex and orbiofrontal cortex.

patents.name: Real-time in-ear electroencephalography signal verification
patents.summary: Real-time in-ear EEG signal verification system for an in-ear device.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
